verses.verse: There are many plans in a man’s heart, (Ps. 33:10, 11; Prov. 16:9; Is. 46:10; Heb. 6:17) Nevertheless the LORD’s counsel—that will stand.
What is desired in a man is kindness, And a poor man is better than a liar.
(Prov. 14:27; (1 Tim. 4:8)) The fear of the LORD leads to life, And he who has it will abide in satisfaction; He will not be visited with evil.
(Prov. 15:19) A lazy man buries his hand in the bowl, And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Strike a scoffer, and the simple (Deut. 13:11) will become wary; (Prov. 9:8) Rebuke one who has understanding, and he will discern knowledge.
He who mistreats his father and chases away his mother Is (Prov. 17:2) a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
Cease listening to instruction, my son, And you will stray from the words of knowledge.
A disreputable witness scorns justice, And (Job 15:16) the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
Judgments are prepared for scoffers, (Prov. 26:3) And beatings for the backs of fools.
Wine (Gen. 9:21; Prov. 23:29-35; Is. 28:7; Hos. 4:11) is a mocker, Strong drink is a brawler, And whoever is led astray by it is not wise.
The wrath of a king is like the roaring of a lion; Whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own life.
(Prov. 17:14) It is honorable for a man to stop striving, Since any fool can start a quarrel.
(Prov. 10:4) The lazy man will not plow because of winter; (Prov. 19:15) He will beg during harvest and have nothing.
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water, But a man of understanding will draw it out.
Most men will proclaim each his own goodness, But who can find a faithful man?
(2 Cor. 1:12) The righteous man walks in his integrity; (Ps. 37:26) His children are blessed after him.
A king who sits on the throne of judgment Scatters all evil with his eyes.
((1 Kin. 8:46; 2 Chr. 6:36); Job 9:30, 31; 14:4; (Ps. 51:5; Eccl. 7:20; Rom. 3:9; 1 John 1:8)) Who can say, “I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin”?
(Deut. 25:13) Diverse weights and diverse measures, They are both alike, an abomination to the LORD.
Even a child is (Matt. 7:16) known by his deeds, Whether what he does is pure and right.
(Ex. 4:11; Ps. 94:9) The hearing ear and the seeing eye, The LORD has made them both.
(Rom. 12:11) Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty; Open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with bread.
“It is good for nothing,” cries the buyer; But when he has gone his way, then he boasts.
There is gold and a multitude of rubies, But ((Job 28:12-19; Prov. 3:13-15)) the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
(Prov. 22:26) Take the garment of one who is surety for a stranger, And hold it as a pledge when it is for a seductress.
(Prov. 9:17) Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man, But afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
(Prov. 24:6) Plans are established by counsel; (Luke 14:31) By wise counsel wage war.
(Prov. 11:13) He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets; Therefore do not associate with one (Rom. 16:18) who flatters with his lips.
(Ex. 21:17; Lev. 20:9; Prov. 30:11; Matt. 15:4) Whoever curses his father or his mother, (Job 18:5, 6; Prov. 24:20) His lamp will be put out in deep darkness.
(Prov. 28:20) An inheritance gained hastily at the beginning (Hab. 2:6) Will not be blessed at the end.
